DataElement.preferredName: Amendment Change Summary Document Version Or Media Text Content ISO21090.ED.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A document, memo or brief that enumerates the differences between two versions of a study protocol document. OTHER NAME(S): Amendment A textual or media-based representation that is the full or comprehensive narrative or content of the document.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Amendment Change Summary Document Version Or Media Text Content
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any mechanism of mass communication.:The words of something written.:Everything that is included in a collection, container, or communication.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of work.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A change in a document made by correction, adding, substituting or omitting a certain part. Amendments are the mechanism of changes introduction, further development and improvement of previously submitted or approved clinical study protocols and proposals.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any mechanism of mass communication.:The words of something written.:Everything that is included in a collection, container, or communication.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Everything that is included in a collection, container, or communication.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Data only for human interpretation or machine processing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
